1.text: Rivulets of waters is the heart of a king in the hand of Jehovah, Wherever He pleaseth He inclineth it.

2.text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, And Jehovah is pondering hearts.

3.text: To do righteousness and judgment, Is chosen of Jehovah rather than sacrifice.

4.text: Loftiness of eyes, and breadth of heart, Tillage of the wicked is sin.

5.text: The purposes of the diligent are only to advantage, And of every hasty one, only to want.

6.text: The making of treasures by a lying tongue, Is a vanity driven away of those seeking death.

7.text: The spoil of the wicked catcheth them, Because they have refused to do judgment.

8.text: Froward is the way of a man who is vile, And the pure—upright is his work.

9.text: Better to sit on a corner of the roof, Than with a woman of contentions and a house of company.

10.text: The soul of the wicked hath desired evil, Not gracious in his eyes is his neighbour.

11.text: When the scorner is punished, the simple becometh wise, And in giving understanding to the wise He receiveth knowledge.

12.text: The Righteous One is acting wisely Towards the house of the wicked, He is overthrowing the wicked for wickedness.

13.text: Whoso is shutting his ear from the cry of the poor, He also doth cry, and is not answered.

14.text: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, And a bribe in the bosom strong fury.

15.text: To do justice is joy to the righteous, But ruin to workers of iniquity.

16.text: A man who is wandering from the way of understanding, In an assembly of Rephaim resteth.

17.text: Whoso is loving mirth is a poor man, Whoso is loving wine and oil maketh no wealth.

18.text: The wicked is an atonement for the righteous, And for the upright the treacherous dealer.

19.text: Better to dwell in a wilderness land, Than with a woman of contentions and anger.

20.text: A treasure to be desired, and oil, Is in the habitation of the wise, And a foolish man swalloweth it up.

21.text: Whoso is pursuing righteousness and kindness, Findeth life, righteousness, and honour.

22.text: A city of the mighty hath the wise gone up, And bringeth down the strength of its confidence.

23.text: Whoso is keeping his mouth and his tongue, Is keeping from adversities his soul.

24.text: Proud, haughty, scorner is his name, Who is working in the wrath of pride.

25.text: The desire of the slothful slayeth him, For his hands have refused to work.

26.text: All the day desiring he hath desired, And the righteous giveth and withholdeth not.

27.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination, Much more when in wickedness he bringeth it.

28.text: A false witness doth perish, And an attentive man for ever speaketh.

29.text: A wicked man hath hardened by his face, And the upright—he prepareth his way.

30.text: There is no wisdom, nor understanding, Nor counsel, over-against Jehovah.

31.text: A horse is prepared for a day of battle, And the deliverance is of Jehovah!
